messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

I can see that your location service is enabled, but I don't have access to your current location coordinates. To help you find what city you're in, I would need your current latitude and longitude coordinates. 

You can usually find your coordinates through:
- Your device's GPS/location settings
- A maps app on your device
- A web browser that can access your location

Once you have your latitude and longitude coordinates, I can help you identify what city you're in using the address lookup function.
I don't have any location tools here.

I understand you don't have access to location tools to get your coordinates. Unfortunately, I don't have a function that can directly determine your current location - I can only look up addresses when given specific latitude and longitude coordinates.

The functions I have available are designed to work with coordinates you provide, rather than automatically detecting your location. Without your specific coordinates, I'm not able to determine what city you're in.

If you're able to get your coordinates from another source (like asking a voice assistant, checking a weather app that shows location, or using any other method), I'd be happy to help identify the city once you have those numbers.
I guess I can try using another app to find that info.

That sounds like a good plan! Once you're able to get your latitude and longitude coordinates from another app, just share them with me and I'll be able to look up what city you're in for you.

Many weather apps, map apps, or even just asking a voice assistant can give you those coordinates. Feel free to come back when you have them!
